Register.desc: Position input for interpolation data record in counts. Unless only one parameter is used in the buffer, use interpolation data record parameters with cyclic communications.
Velocity input for interpolation data record in rev/s. Unless only one parameter is used in the buffer, use interpolation data record parameters with cyclic communications.

Time input for interpolation data record in milliseconds. Only the first 16 bits are used. Unless only one parameter is used in the buffer, use interpolation data record parameters with cyclic communications.

This parameter is used to append new PT or PVT data to the interpolated position buffer and is used as a check as well. Data is added to the buffer every time this parameter increases by a value of 1. In other words, to start adding data into the interpolation data record:
1 - Read this parameter 2 - Fill in the interpolation data record with the desired point 3 - Add 1 to the value read in this parameter.
This process can be done with cyclic communications and the value can be added in each transmission without having to read the value again.
Contains the status of the interpolation buffer (enabled, running, full or empty)
Indicates the continuous current of the actuator / system
User peak current
User allowed peak current time
Pole pairs of the actuator
User maximum allowed voltage
Motor temperature threshold where derating is started to be applied
Indicates the type of temperature sensor used for motor temperature readings 0: NTC 1: PTC 2: RTD
NTC: Resistance value for 25 ºC in ohms PTC: Resistance value where the over-temperature must be detected in ohms Others: Not used.
NTC: B(25/85) parameter from datasheet PTC: Not used Others: Not used
NTC: Resistance in ohms connected to NTC for making the voltage divider PTC: Resistance in ohms connected to PTC for making the voltage divider Others: Not used.
NTC: Not used PTC: Contains the voltage applied on the voltage divider by the gain of possible amplifiers Others: Gain of the sensor
NTC: Not used PTC: Not used Others: Offset of the sensor
Voltage threshold to enable internal shunt braking resistor
Voltage threshold to disable internal shunt braking resistor
Voltage threshold to enable external shunt braking resistor
Voltage threshold to disable external shunt braking resistor
Percentage of voltage applied to the brake.
Indicates the delay in milliseconds the brake starts holding the actual position before the drive stops driving the actuator.
Indicates the delay in milliseconds the brake is still holding the position after the drive starts driving the actuator.
Specifies the modulation used to drive the actuator
Angle offset between the reference feedback vs commutation feedback in revolutions.
Indicates the sensor used for angle readings
Offset between the generated 0 angle position of the drive and the value read by the reference feedback sensor. It is computed automatically by a forced phasing method.
Indicates the reference angle sensor used for angle readings.
Indicates the method of actuator alignment
Maximum allowed current during phasing sequence
Indicates the maximum time that a step is applied in the forced method if the next step condition is not reached.
Determines the number of steps, the minimum displacement distance and the steps discretization of the binary search method
User allowed maximum current
Maximum allowed speed in both directions
User minimum allowed position
User maximum allowed position
Indicates the maximum allowed difference between demand and actual position before generating a fault.
Indicates the maximum time the difference between demand and actual position is allowed to be outside the position window.
Difference between demand and actual position in counts
It is used to indicate the interpolation time period between set-point values.
It is used to indicate the interpolation time period between set-point values.
Window around Position set-point inside which target can be considered reached
Time that the error between Position set-point and Actual position has to be smaller than Position window before detecting a target reached
Window around Velocity set-point inside which target can be considered reached
Time that the error between Velocity set-point and Actual velocity has to be smaller than Velocity window before detecting a target reached
Deceleration used to slow down when quick stop state is active
Any value written to this parameter will force a clear of
User defined buffer size. By default it takes maximum buffer size.
Containts the number of interpolation data records that are contained inside the buffer.
Returns the maximum number of data records that can be stored in the interpolation buffer
Indicates the source of the set-points for the motion.
Gain applied to the unitary analog input 1 readings. Unitary means a value of 0 when 0 counts are read and 1 when full range counts are read.
Offset applied to analog input 1 readings after gain amplification.
Gain applied to the unitary analog input 2 readings. Unitary means a value of 0 when 0 counts are read and 1 when full range counts are read.
Offset applied to analog input 2 readings after gain amplification.

Restart the waveform generation

Selects the position feedback sensor
Indicates the sensor used for raw value reading

Ratio between revolutions in position sensor against revolutions in velocity sensor [revs in position sensor / revs in velocity sensor]
For instance, if 1 revolution at the position sensor locations equals 50 revolutions where the velocity sensor is located, the ratio should be 1/50.

Shows the status of the safe torque off circuit of the board.
Bit 0: STO1 input Bit 1: STO2 input Bit 2: STO supply fault input (active low) Bit 3: STO abnormal fault input Bit 4: STO report input
STO status = 0x017 means no errors and motor can be enabled.
